SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: I know there are a number of ppl on here who are in baltimore co in various places; any of you in bawlmer proper, stay safe. <img src="images/smilies/frown.gif" border="0" alt="" title="Frown" class="inlineimg">

15 police officers injured, now on Fox news (sorry I know many don't like it) but there are now men walking down the streets "taking it back" peacefully, they are singing - a hymn/gospel there are hundreds of them. They are singing "I will treat everybody right, I will treat everybody right til I die" Earlier there were religious leaders planning something Like this I believe. I've got chills.
I watched the looting of the drug store, the burning of the cop cars, and the throwing of bricks and bottles. Disgusting.

15 police officers injured, now on Fox news (sorry I know many don't like it) but there are now men walking down the streets "taking it back" peacefully, they are singing - a hymn/gospel there are hundreds of them. They are singing "I will treat everybody right, I will treat everybody right til I die" Earlier there were religious leaders planning something Like this I believe. I've got chills.
That's good to hear. The family is also asking for peace.

Having grown up near Bal'mer, with lots of family in and around the city, I am so sad to see what is going on there. I am praying that they can take the city back in peace. Continued violence will only breed more violence.
C'mon, Charm City - you are better than this.

Baltimore you're breaking my heart. This area is the most poverty stricken area of Baltimore with the worst schools, high levels of lead poisoning, with no job prospects and no hope. Those faces you see on TV? Those are the faces of hopelessness and despair.

Baltimore's policing is a mess (they have been trying to clean it up). They just made $5M in settlements for police violence and that was before the death of Freddy Grey. The residents of Sandtown-Winchester are angry, they are frustrated, they have outside agitators and gangs inciting violence. This doesn't excuse the violence, but it does begin to explain it.

And I must say tonight that a riot is the language of the unheard. And what is it America has failed to hear? It has failed to hear that the plight of the negro poor has worsened over the last twelve or fifteen years. It has failed to hear that the promises of freedom and justice have not been met. And it has failed to hear that large segments of white society are more concerned about tranquility and the status quo than about justice and humanity. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
Gottgrey, thank you for you post pointing out that the community is attempting to take their streets back.

I heard the mayor and member of the City Council news conference on the car radio while heading home. She said they won't let the thugs (her word) destroy the city. The councilman said the same thing. A 10:00pm to 5:00am curfew is in effect for everyone. All leave for police has been cancelled and the National Guard is en-route. Swift, decisive leadership in the face of the thugs- good job.
Language of the unheard indeed. If income disparity continues to grow as it is, that language will be spoken more and more.
This has been building up for literally decades.
Agree with Laura^^ that the violence is very sad - but also explainable.

Baltimore has settled what - 102 cases of wrongful death, assault and imprisonment? With more waiting in the docket. That's taxpayer money that could fund better law enforcement and programs to help fight poverty. I know they're trying, but it's not exactly working. Which is not to say I have any answers.
As of Sept 2014, Baltimore alone had paid out almost $6 million since 2011 over lawsuits claiming police officers brazenly beat up alleged suspects.

Baltimore you're breaking my heart. This area is the most poverty stricken area of Baltimore with the worst schools, high levels of lead poisoning, with no job prospects and no hope. Those faces you see on TV? Those are the faces of hopelessness and despair.

I'm sitting here in Canton listening to an ice cream truck in counterpoint to the fire and police sirens. It is surreal. I don't know what to say about any of this, except that we need to be careful not to conflate people who have peacefully protested for a week with the rioters.
As of Sept 2014, Baltimore alone had paid out almost $6 million since 2011 over lawsuits claiming police officers brazenly beat up alleged suspects.

Not an excuse to burn down your city. If it wasn't for innocent bystanders and people that worked hard to build up their businesses, I would say walk away and let them burn it down if that is what they want. These thugs don't give a hoot about what happened to Freddie Grey, they just want an excuse to hurt people and destroy property.

Not an excuse to burn down your city. If it wasn't for innocent bystanders and people that worked hard to build up their businesses, I would say walk away and let them burn it down if that is what they want. These thugs don't give a hoot about what happened to Freddie Grey, they just want an excuse to hurt people and destroy property.

Nobody said it was, MaggieMae. However, as long as bad cops keep killing unarmed individuals and profiling blacks, it will continue to get worse. And, as Renn said above................"I don't know what to say about any of this, except that we need to be careful not to conflate people who have peacefully protested for a week with the rioters."

Well everyone is paying attention now, aren't they? How, exactly, did a young man suffer a fatal spinal injury in the custody of law enforcement? I can't wait to hear how Mr. Gray is responsible for his own death. I thought if you submitted to arrest and didn't resist you would be fine? Guess not.

I'm in Towson and the University that I attend had a threat of an armed man in the library today right after I started walking home! Our mall is closed too and I've heard rumors of the riots moving over this way... my house is just 15 minutes away. I'm pretty scared <img src="images/smilies/frown.gif" border="0" alt="" title="Frown" class="inlineimg"> I fully support the peaceful protestors.

I grew up in the suburbs of BMore and currently live in North BMore County. I love the city, although prefer living in the country. I mostly go into the city for Ravens and Orioles games, and the spirit of the residents on game day is awesome! But there is so much poverty and it's tough to get away from it in the city. Breaking the cycle of poverty is so difficult, and there is a lot of work to be done in BMore, including getting rid of the corruption in government and government agencies. Hope the city rallies and peace returns soon.
Posts that consist solely of a link look like spam to me.
From a civil rights activist friend in Baltimore...sounds like the mayor really screwed up.

"Are any of you actually here? Because while there are opportunists among the masses out there, please be advised of the following: "So what you're telling me is that you got a tip that there was going to be a riot at Mondawmin, which happens to be a major MTA hub.

You let kids out of school early because of said riot that is going to happen, knowing all those kids take the bus to/from school anyway. Teenagers (who happen to be harassed by police more than anyone else anyway) arrive at Mondawmin (as they do every damn day) except this time there are police lined up in riot gear waiting for them. Then you suspend service at Mondawmin FIRST and then the rest of the city..... but tell them to go home. *sigh*

Do you understand how goddamned hopeless you have to feel to go against guns with rocks? Like.... seriously. Also note that at least 25% of city students live below the poverty line." This wasn't arbitrary. It directly followed 6 days of peaceful protests that failed to be derailed despite racists on the sidelines instigating violence that mysteriously went unmentioned by the media. Directly followed by protests that drew attention to a vast history of police brutality in this city. There are people who make the worst of every situation, but the majority of what is happening here is not what anyone who ISN't here is being told......Just an offering."
